column3: et univèrsi qŭi hábitant in eo. ^ The earth is the Lord's and the fulness thereof~; the world
column4: and all they that dwell therein.

column1: 2 ^ Qŭia ìpse super mária fundávit eum
column2: et super flúmina praĕparávit eum. ^ For he hath founded it upon the seas~; and hath prepared it upon the rivers.

column1: 3 ^ ¿~Qŭìs ascèndet in mòntem Dòmini~? ¿~Aŭt qŭìs stabit in loco sancto ejus~? ^ Who shall ascend into the mountain of the Lord
column2: or who shall stand in his holy place~?
qŭi non accépit in vano ánimam suam
column3: nec jurávit in dolo pròximo suo~; ^ The innocent in hands and clean of heart
column4: who hath not taken his soul in vain
column5: nor sworn deceitfully to his neighbour~;

column2: et misericórdiam a Deo salutári suo. ^ he shall receive a blessing from the Lord
column3: and mercy from God his Saviour.

column2: qŭaĕrèntium fáciem Dei Jacóbis. ^ This is the generation of them that seek him
column3: of them that seek the face of the God of Jacob.

column5: et introíbit rex glóriaĕ. ^ Lift up the gates
column9: and the King of Glory shall enter in.

column1: 8 ^ ¿~Qŭìs est ìste rex glóriaĕ~? Dòminus fortis et potens~; Dòminus potens in práĕlio. ^ Who is this King of Glory~? The Lord who is strong and mighty~; the Lord mighty in battle.

column5: et introíbit rex glóriaĕ. ^ Lift up the gates
column9: and the King of Glory shall enter in.

column1: 10 ^ ¿~Qŭìs est ìste rex glóriaĕ~? Dòminus virtútum ìpse est rex glóriaĕ. ^ Who is this King of Glory~? the Lord of hosts
column2: he is the King of Glory.
